alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Heard; Meriwether; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 5:29PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Meriwether, southeastern Heard, Troup and southern Coweta Counties through 600 PM EST... At 529 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Corinth to Buffalo, and moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Hogansville, Grantville, Luthersville, Haralson, Lone Oak, Corinth, Mountville, Cannonville, Louise, Odessadale, Stovall, Piedmont Heights, Harrisonville, Hillcrest, Big Springs, Wares Crossroads, Rocky Mount, Saint Marks and State Line Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
